description: 'Musk Fictions' (1/6). The billionaire has long drawn inspiration from 'The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy', Douglas Adams's cult sci-fi series about artificial intelligence, towels and the destruction of Earth.

One year after the revolution in Bangladesh, Islamists have resurged
description: After the fall of Sheikh Hasina on August 5, 2024, the country's largest Muslim party − which had been forced to operate in the shadows for a decade − has returned to the political stage. The next elections have been promised to be held no later than June 2026.

headline: Macabre video of the last hostages held by Hamas shocks Israel
description: The families of hostages are calling for an end to the war in order to negotiate the release of those still held captive. But the footage has also reinforced support for Benjamin Netanyahu's desire to prolong the war.

headline: AI is sowing discord in the world of fanfiction
description: Fanfiction authors often regard the emergence of AI-generated stories with suspicion, and the technology is shaking up the values within fan communities.

headline: After Ferrand-Prévot's triumph in the Tour de France Femmes, France 'is now enamored by women's cycling'
description: The French cyclist claimed victory in the iconic race on Sunday, with international media reporting that the fourth edition 'delivered' on all expectations.

description: Maïa Mazaurette is on a mission to spice up your steamy summer nights. This week, she suggests doing absolutely nothing – except letting your thoughts wander, caressing yourself for a long time and questioning your certainties.

headline: Nevado del Ruiz, the explosive titan of the Andes
description: 'Of Volcanoes and Men' (2/6). French photographer Marguerite Bornhauser ventured onto the Colombian volcano, at an altitude of over 5,000 meters, in the summer of 2024. She captured the strangeness of its sculpted landscapes, using colored filters to highlight the fiery nature of our planet.

headline: At Michel and Sébastien Bras' restaurant, a taste for the world passes from father to son
description: 'Chefs' Gardens' (5/5). The father-son duo have brought back countless varieties of plants from their travels abroad, showcasing them in their dishes at Le Suquet, their restaurant in southern France.
